14.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE?

answers.A: One benefit to the use of machine languages is improved programming efficiency compared to a symbolic language.
answers.B: The process of converting a high-level language to machine language is known as compilation.
answers.C: Code written in a low-level programming language is portable to many different computers.

15.question: Which of the following statements regarding output is FALSE?

answers.A: The width modifier for the output of a value must be large enough to account for the integral value of the number, the decimal point, and the number of digits in the decimal position.
answers.B: The conversion code selected for a placeholder depends on the data type of the value to be displayed in a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">printf</font> statement.
answers.C: A precision modifier may be used to limit the number of digits to display in an integer value.

16.question: Which of the following statements regarding constant data is FALSE?

answers.A: A literal constant is an unnamed constant used to specify data.
answers.B: While variables have data types, the values represented by constants do not.
answers.C: A character constant is enclosed in single quotes.

17.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE?

answers.A: The <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">main</font> function beings with a section for preprocessor directives.
answers.B: Only the code found in the executable statement section of the <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">main</font> function is considered to be the body of the function.
answers.C: The <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">gcc</font> compiler as found on <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">guru</font> will require that <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">main</font> be a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">void</font> function.

18.question: Which of the following statements regarding operators in the C programming language is FALSE?

answers.A: When two operators with the same precedence occur in an expression and their associativity is left-to-right, the left operator is evaluated first.
answers.B: All of the compound assignment operators share the same level of operator precedence.
answers.C: Operator precedence can be used to bind operators to operands and from that will determine the order of operations in an expression.

19.question: Which of the following statements regarding expressions is FALSE?

answers.A: The value of the postfix increment expression is determined before the variable is increased.
answers.B: The operand in a postfix or prefix expression must be a variable.
answers.C: The result of an expression is undefined when it attempts to modify a single variable more than once.

20.question: Which of the following statements regarding user-defined functions is FALSE?

answers.A: A called function may <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">return</font> at most one value to the <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">main</font> function per call.
answers.B: The control of the program always returns from the called function to the <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">main</font> function.
answers.C: Data sent from the <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">main</font> function to the function being called will be received in the same order in which it was passed.

21.question: Which of the following statements regarding parameters and user-defined functions is TRUE?

answers.A: Parameters being received by a function will be commented to the right of where they are defined.
answers.B: A variable declared in the local declaration section of a function can have the same identifier as one of the parameters of that same function.
answers.C: The order of the data types of the parameters in a function declaration must match the order of the parameters listed in the function definition.

22.question: Which of the following statements regarding the scope of a variable is FALSE?

answers.A: Two variables may use the same identifier as long as their scope does not overlap in a program.
answers.B: A variable declared in the local declaration section of a function has a scope that extends until the end of the program.
answers.C: The scope of a variable or function determines the region of the program in which it is defined.

23.question: Which of the following statements regarding structure charts is TRUE?

answers.A: No code is contained in a structure chart and only demonstrates the function flow through the program.
answers.B: Each rectangle on a structure chart represents the user-defined and standard library functions used in a program.
answers.C: A structure chart will not display the data that is exchanged between functions.

24.question: Which of the following statements regarding parameter passing is FALSE?

answers.A: The called function must declare a special type of variable known as a pointer to store a memory address that is sent from the calling function.
answers.B: The asterisk has two different uses, declaring a pointer variable and indirectly accessing the data.
answers.C: The address operator (<font style="font-family:'Courier New'">&</font>) when used in a function declaration indicates that the parameter will not be a data variable rather a pointer variable.

25.question: Which of the following statements regarding parameter passing is FALSE?

answers.A: A function that passes at least one parameter by address must pass them all by address.
answers.B: Not every function that utilizes pass by address are necessarily <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">void</font> functions.
answers.C: One benefit of pass by address is that it allows multiple changes to be made in a function and to have those changes available in the calling function.

answers.A: When the data types of two operands for the division operator are different, the lower-ranked type is promoted to the rank of the higher type.
answers.B: In an assignment statement, promotion occurs if the right expression has a lower rank than the variable on the left and demotion occurs if the right expression has a higher rank.

answers.B: Multi-line comments can be nested, that is a multi-line comment can be found inside of another multiline comment.
answers.C: When related variables are declared in the local declaration section of a function only the first one must be commented.

30.question: Which of the following statements regarding expressions is FALSE?

answers.A: An expression always reduces to a single value.
answers.B: If multiple variables are modified once in an expression then the result is undefined.
answers.C: The left operand in an assignment expression must be a single variable.

31.question: Which of the following statements regarding explicit data type conversions is FALSE?

answers.A: An assignment type conversion may result in a higher ranked data type being converted into a lower ranked data type.
answers.B: Explicit data type conversions can only be applied to variables and not to literal or symbolic/defined constants.
answers.C: The result of an explicit data type conversion may include the loss of data when a higher ranked data type is converted to a lower ranked data type.

32.question: Which of the following statements regarding user-defined function parameters and local variables is FALSE?

answers.A: Parameters are defined in the first line of the function definition.
answers.B: Parameters in the function definition are initialized by the value they receive from the calling function.
answers.C: A variable declared in the local declaration section of a function can have the same identifier as one of the parameters of the same function.

33.question: Which of the following statements regarding the first line of the function definition is TRUE?

answers.A: The first line of the function definition requires the data types and identifiers for each parameter.
answers.B: The first line of the function definition terminates with a semicolon (;).
answers.C: The first line of the function definition does not require an explicit return type for the function.

34.question: Which of the following statements regarding user-defined function use is FALSE?

answers.A: The order in which the user-defined functions are defined does not need to match the same order in which they are called by the main function.
answers.B: The order in which user-defined functions are called must match the same order in which they have been declared.
answers.C: The order in which the user-defined functions are defined does not need to match the same order in which they have been declared.

answers.C: It is possible to redirect some lines of output generated by a program to an external file while some of the lines of output can be sent to the monitor.

answers.C: The application of recursion must be limited to event-controlled processes.

25.question: Which of the following statements regarding the result of the modulus operator is TRUE?

answers.A: The possible result of the following for any non-negative integer x is 0 or 1: <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">(x + 1) % x</font>
answers.B: The result of the following for any non-negative integer x is 1: <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">(x + 2) % (x + 1)</font>
answers.C: The result of the following for any non-negative integer x is 0: <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">1 - (x + 2) % (x + 1)</font>

28.question: Which of the following statements regarding looping constructs is FALSE?

answers.A: Immediately following the update action of a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">for</font> loop will be the evaluation of the loop control expression.
answers.B: The initialization of the loop control variable must take place outside the body of a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">do-while</font> loop.
answers.C: In a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">while</font> loop the number of times the loop control expression is evaluated is one more than the number of times the loop will iterate.

32.question: Which of the following statements regarding the <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">switch</font> construct is FALSE?

answers.A: Each <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> label represents an integral type that is a possible result of the control expression.
answers.B: Every <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> label must represent a unique constant expression value.
answers.C: No <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> label may represent an expression with multiple mathematical operators.

3.question: Which of the following statements regarding the rules of the <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">switch</font> construct is FALSE?

answers.A: The expression that follows the keyword <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> may include a mathematical operator.
answers.B: The expression that follows the keyword <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> may include one or more constant operands.
answers.C: The expression that follows the keyword <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> must not represent the same value as any other case.

4.question: Which of the following statements regarding random number generation is TRUE?

answers.A: The <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">srand()</font> function will return a random number.
answers.B: The <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">random()</font> function will return a random number.
answers.C: The <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">rand()</font> function will return a random number.

17.question: Which of the following statements regarding <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">for</font> loops is TRUE?

answers.A: According to the course standards a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">for</font> loop should only be used with counter-controlled processes.
answers.B: According to the course standards all three expressions are not needed in a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">for</font> loop.
answers.C: All <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">while</font> loops must be converted into <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">for</font> loops for counter-controlled processes.

20.question: Which of the following may result in the dangling else logical error?

answers.A: Using the assignment operator (<font style="font-family:'Courier New'">=</font>) when the equality operator (<font style="font-family:'Courier New'">==</font>) is expected.
answers.B: Failing to use { and } with a nested <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">if/else</font> construct.
answers.C: Making use of a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">switch</font> statement inside of an <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">if</font> statement.

21.question: Which of the following statements regarding logical expressions is FALSE?

answers.A: The order of operations in a logical expression and its complement will be the same.
answers.B: The number of parentheses in a logical expression will always be the same found in its complement.
answers.C: A logical expression that contains a NOT operator may also have a NOT operator in its complement.

24.question: Which of the following statements regarding looping constructs is FALSE?

answers.A:
In a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">do-while</font> loop the number of times the loop control expression is evaluated is equal to the number
of iterations.
answers.B:
In a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">for</font> loop the number of times the loop control expression is evaluated is one more than the number
of iterations.
answers.C:
In a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">while</font> loop the number of times the loop control expression is evaluated is one more than the
number of iterations.

31.question: Which of the following statements regarding nested selection and repetition is TRUE?

answers.A: Nested iterative processes cannot be broken up into different user-defined functions.
answers.B:
Iterative processes are only considered to be nested if both the inner loop and outer loop use the same
type of looping statement.
answers.C: Nested selection often involves the evaluation of two different variables in the control expressions.

32.question: Which of the following statements regarding the <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">switch</font> construct is FALSE?

answers.A: The <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">default</font> case is optional but when it is used it will not be followed by a constant expression.
answers.B: The expression following the keyword <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> could contain a variable.
answers.C: The executable statements represented by a <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">case</font> may include another <font style="font-family:'Courier New'">switch</font> construct.

33.question: Which of the following statements regarding counter-controlled processes is FALSE?

answers.A:
The loop control variable in a counter-controlled process can only be incremented or decremented by
one.
answers.B:
The total number of iterations in a counter-controlled process can be determined prior to the first
iteration.
answers.C: An iterative solution to a counter-controlled process may include either pretest or post-test constructs.

34.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding redirection of output?

answers.A: Attempting to redirect output to an existing file will result in an error.
answers.B: The redirection of output is always accompanied by the use of redirection for input.
answers.C: When redirecting output, all generated output is sent to the external file.
